availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: J. D. Kincaid (Catlettsburg, Boyd County, Kentucky, physician)

body.p: Catlettsburg, Boyd County, Kentucky, physician. Virginia native. Married to Lenora F. Kincaid. Father of Andrew S. Kincaid, Emma V. Kincaid, James H.W. Kincaid, and Eva J. Kincaid. Physician in Greenup County, Kentucky in 1850. Physician in Catlettsburg, Boyd County, Kentucky in 1860. Owned two enslaved individuals in Catlettsburg, Boyd County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Greenup County, District 2, p. 193B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Boyd County, Catlettsburg, p. 795.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Boyd County, p. 1.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Boyd County, Catlettsburg, p. 109A.
Find A Grave, "James Dickison Kincaid (Jun 5, 1819-1889)," Memorial #187512674, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/187512674 (accessed May 22, 2020).
